articles.description: Chris Woakes says rehabilitation "could be a risk he's willing to take" to be fit for the Ashes, rather than having surgery on his shoulder injury.
articles.title: England: Chris Woakes may risk rehab over surgery to be fit for Ashes

articles.description: Armando Broja's move to Burnley means Chelsea have now made more than £250m in sales on players from their academy in the last three seasons.
articles.title: Chelsea: Armando Broja's Burnley move takes academy sales past £250m in three years

articles.description: Victoria Mboko wins her first WTA title by coming from behind to beat Naomi Osaka in the Canadian Open final.
articles.title: Victoria Mboko beats Naomi Osaka to win maiden WTA title at Canadian Open

articles.description: BBC Sport looks at who can challenge Liverpool this season after a summer of big recruitment from several teams.
articles.title: Premier League: Who are most likely to challenge Liverpool this season?

articles.description: Birmingham Phoenix face Trent Rockets in the men’s Hundred - follow live scores, radio commentary and updates.
articles.title: The Hundred 2025 LIVE: Birmingham Phoenix vs Trent Rockets - cricket score, radio & updates

articles.description: With the Championship about to get under way, BBC Sport looks at whether Ipswich, Leicester and Southampton have an unfair advantage.
articles.title: Parachute payments: Do Ipswich, Leicester & Southampton have unfair advantage?

articles.description: England captain Nat Sciver-Brunt hit 64 but her Trent Rockets side lost by 11 runs against Birmingham Phoenix in The Hundred.
articles.title: The Hundred 2025 results: Sciver-Brunt's 64 not enough as Phoenix beat Rockets

articles.description: Fans share their stories of why they support their clubs - from meeting Nottingham Forest boss Brian Clough to falling in love with Spurs stars Paul Gascoigne and Gary Lineker at Italia '90.
articles.title: Premier League fans on why they love their clubs - Clough, Gascoigne, Shankly

articles.description: An estimated 12,000 football supporters have been scammed by online ticket fraud in the past two years.
articles.title: Football fans scammed out of estimated £2.5m by "ruthless" fraudsters

articles.description: Swansea City's chief executive officer Tom Gorringe discusses the roles of high-profile investors Snoop Dogg and Luka Modric and his side's hopes for the remainder of the transfer window.
articles.title: Swansea City: 'Everything's on the table', says chief executive officer Tom Gorringe
